title: 2014-B
statement: B. Robin Hood and the Major Oaktime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputIn Sherwood, the trees are our shelter, and we are all children of the forest.The Major Oak in Sherwood is known for its majestic foliage, which provided shelter to Robin Hood and his band of merry men and women.The Major Oak grows $$$i^i$$$ new leaves in the $$$i$$$-th year. It starts with $$$1$$$ leaf in year $$$1$$$.Leaves last for $$$k$$$ years on the tree. In other words, leaves grown in year $$$i$$$ last between years $$$i$$$ and $$$i+k-1$$$ inclusive.Robin considers even numbers lucky. Help Robin determine whether the Major Oak will have an even number of leaves in year $$$n$$$.InputThe first line of the input contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 10^4$$$) — the number of test cases.Each test case consists of two integers $$$n$$$, $$$k$$$ ($$$1 \\le n \\le 10^9$$$, $$$1 \\le k \\le n$$$) — the requested year and the number of years during which the leaves remain.OutputFor each test case, output one line, "YES" if in year $$$n$$$ the Major Oak will have an even number of leaves and "NO" otherwise.You can output the answer in any case (upper or lower). For example, the strings "yEs", "yes", "Yes", and "YES" will be recognized as positive responses.ExampleInput51 12 12 23 24 4OutputNO YES NO NO YESNoteIn the first test case, there is only $$$1$$$ leaf.In the second test case, $$$k=1$$$, so in the $$$2$$$-nd year there will be $$$2^2=4$$$ leaves.In the third test case, $$$k=2$$$, so in the $$$2$$$-nd year there will be $$$1+2^2=5$$$ leaves.In the fourth test case, $$$k=2$$$, so in the $$$3$$$-rd year there will be $$$2^2 + 3^3 = 4 + 27 = 31$$$ leaves.

A tree grows $i^i$ new leaves in the $i$-th year. The tree starts with 1 leaf in year 1. Leaves last for $k$ years on the tree.  

Given a year $n$ and the number of years leaves last $k$, determine if the tree will have an even number of leaves in year $n$.
A tree grows a certain number of leaves each year. Leaves last for a fixed number of years.  Determine if the tree will have an even number of leaves in a given year.
